sect2.title: Syntax
sect2.synopsis: <!ELEMENT move (option?, source+, destination)> <!ATTLIST move base CDATA #IMPLIED>

sect2.title: Description
sect2.para: The move element is one of the top-level operation elements. It can be used to move one or more files and/or directories into a destination directory, or to rename a single file or directory.
The option sub-element provides a means to pass an option to the mv command.

note.para: Not all of the mv options are in every implementation. Refer to the documentation for your implementation to determine what options are available.

sect2.para: When processing this element, you move each source to the destination, using the specified option if present.
The source sub-element contains the name of the source file and its directory.
The destination sub-element contains the name of the destination directory (and, optionally, the command) for the mv command.
The base attribute supplies a directory for the move operations to be executed in; it will only affect relative source and/or destination paths (those that do not begin with a leading slash). See .
